entry.title: Introduction to Docker
entry.summary: I have been playing around with Docker during the last few days ,and I am quite impressed by its abilities. I am writing this blog to share what I have learnt by trying to dockerize a simple Flask app. What is Docker? Docker is an open source containerizing platform, It enables developers package their applications into containers. What is a Container? According to Google, Containers ar...

entry.title: Using Selenium in Python
entry.summary: Today we are going to learn how to automate your browser using Selenium in Python.Today we will go to Youtube search something and store the results as JSON.Scraping Youtube results is not possible using normal webscraping as it uses a JS framework. Requirements For web scraping we would require selenium library. Just install it with pip as: pip3 install selenium You would also r...

entry.title: Web scraping in Python
entry.summary: Today we are going to learn how to scrape a website in python. We will be scraping google to find results and store them as JSON. Requirements For web scraping we would require two libraries: requests bs4 Just install them with pip as: pip3 install requests bs4 Starting first we would need to import the required libraries: import requests from bs4 import Beautifu...

entry.title: Linked lists
entry.summary: In link list a structure is declared as head and it has a next pointer which points to next item in the list and similarly all items have a next pointer.The next pointer of the last element points to NULL.The program goes as long as user does not input n.The user has two options whether to insert or delete from the list.In insert we declare a temporary variable temp which contains the number to...

entry.title: Dynamic declaration of structure using pointer

link.title: Dynamic declaration of structure using pointer

entry.summary: We can dynamically declare sturrcture is C++ using just new and the name of the structure.To access its inner variables we have to use -> instead of . as it is a pointer ,however we can us . with * behind the pointer so that it becomes a structure variable. #include<iostream> using namespace std; struct boy { char name[80]; int age; }; int main() { boy *b1; b1...
